description: Comprehensive catalog of all available test automation script functions for the test automation framework

function_args.file_path: str (required) - Path to the file to validate
function_args.expected_permission: str (optional) - Expected file permissions in octal format (e.g., '644')

scripts.description: Comprehensive file validation function that checks file existence, permissions, ownership, and group membership. Supports both Windows and Linux systems with platform-specific validation for ownership and group checks. Returns standardized result structure with success/failure indicators.

return_structure.returncode: int - 0 for success, non-zero for failure

function_args.file_path: str (required) - Path where the file should be created
function_args.content: str (optional) - Content to write to the file
function_args.permissions: int (optional) - File permissions as octal integer (e.g., 0o644)
function_args.ensure_parent_dirs: bool (optional) - Create parent directories if they don't exist (default: true)

scripts.description: File creation utility that creates files at specified paths with optional content and permissions. Supports automatic parent directory creation and temporary directory usage with <tmp> tags. Useful for test setup and temporary file operations.

return_structure.returncode: int - 0 for success, non-zero for failure

function_args.run_location: str (optional) - Working directory for command execution
function_args.search_string: str (optional) - String to search for in stdout/stderr for validation

scripts.description: Cross-platform command execution function that runs commands on Windows (PowerShell) or Linux (bash) systems. Supports working directory specification, timeout control, and output validation through search string matching. Automatically detects platform and uses appropriate shell.

return_structure.stdout: str - Standard output from the command
return_structure.stderr: str - Error output from the command
return_structure.returncode: int - 0 for success, non-zero for failure

function_args.url: str (required) - Target URL for the HTTP request
function_args.method: str (optional) - HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.) (default: GET)
function_args.username: str (optional) - Username for basic authentication (legacy parameter)
function_args.password: str (optional) - Password for basic authentication (legacy parameter)
function_args.bearer_token: str (optional) - Bearer token for bearer authentication (legacy parameter)
function_args.body: dict/str (optional) - Request body for POST/PUT requests
function_args.ca_cert: str (optional) - Path to CA certificate file
function_args.verify_ssl: bool (optional) - Enable SSL certificate verification (default: True)
function_args.auth_username: str (optional) - Username for basic authentication (standardized parameter)
function_args.auth_password: str (optional) - Password for basic authentication (standardized parameter)
function_args.auth_token: str (optional) - Token for bearer authentication (standardized parameter)

scripts.description: Comprehensive HTTP request function supporting multiple authentication types, custom headers, request body, proxy configuration, and SSL certificate verification. Supports both legacy authentication parameters and new standardized authentication parameters (auth_username, auth_password, auth_token) for secure credential management.

return_structure.stdout: str - Standard output with response details
return_structure.returncode: int - 0 for success, non-zero for failure

categories.http: HTTP/HTTPS service validations and API testing

usage_notes: All functions return a standardized dictionary structure for consistent error handling
Use <tmp> tags in file_path parameters for temporary directory operations
Platform-specific parameters (like owner/group) are automatically handled based on OS
Return codes: 0=success, 1=test failed, 2=execution error, 3=import error, 4=parameter error
